column5: Canada is pretty big, what area are you heading to? This one is about 2.5 hours west of Thunder Bay.http://www.lacdesmille.com/index.html Good pike action from late june thru mid October.

Well I guess I would prefer a location straight north of Michigan but the NW part of Ontario seems to get most of the press. So yes, I would like something around Wawa or that area if the pike fishing would be good.

I want to take my soon to be 15 year old grandson to Canada and the young man is most interested in lots of pike action with a decent chance for a trophy. I'm looking for a drive-to location with flush toilets and showers. I've got a place in mind but I am looking for options. Thanks for any ideas.
I would take a look at wabaskang lake.lots of fast action and a good chance at some trophy fish.has some camps on it that would take care of all your needs
Another vote for the Old Post Lodge. www.oldpost.com - pretty cushy camp, satisfies your requirements, and very, very comfortable for young and old fishermen.
Obakikon Bay/Lake on LOTW in the Spring. Awesome numbers and sizes.
Lake Minnitaki is great for pike. Lots of them and also lots over 20 pounds. Any of the lodges in the Sioux Lookout area will have accomodations that work well for both of you.
Donnelly's Minnitaki Lake Lodge is where I go with my family every year.

Shoal Lake has to be at the top of the list. Stupid big fish. Very heavy at a given length. Not a pile of options on the lake itself for accommodation (shoal lk lodge) but it is an easy trailer from Kenora to Clytie Bay (paved except last couple hundred yds) and there are lodges on lake of the woods that offer easy boat access into shoal.
